page.title: 16BUCKMORE PARK
page.content: This is a large activity centre built by the scouts. They rent it from the {Bridgewood Trust}on a 99 year lease, 34 years of it have already gone.The park is 200 acres altogether, 100 of our school fields and woods could fit into it.There are another 2,ooo acres around it, mostly{woods,}also owned by Bridgewood Tust. Mr Veale,the director,said 90% of the centre is covered by trees.There is a lot of{wild life}like rabbits,foxes, and squirrels.Wild flowers are all over the place and there are even {orchids}so rare,that he isn't allowed to see them! Scouts come here to learn to{survive on their own outside.They have lots of activities for this but the most impo_ rtant is{camping.}They have 52 camp sites in the trees.2000 a night are here in summer there is room for 6000!
